MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Walter Pitts | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What book did Donald Hebb publish in 1949?
Choices: a: The Organization of Behavior | b: Learning Machines | c: Computing Machinery and Intelligence | d: The Organization of Artificial Neurons

MCQ: What was the purpose of Cybertron, developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Analyze weather patterns | b: Analyze sonar signals, electrocardiograms, and speech patterns | c: Play chess | d: Write poetry

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, what is the definition of machine learning?
Choices: a: A computer program is said to learn from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P if its performance at tasks in T, as measured by P, improves with experience E. | b: Machines can think and feel emotions | c: A computer program can predict the future accurately | d: Machine learning is only concerned with cognitive tasks

MCQ: What are the two objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To cook food and clean the house | b: To classify data based on models and make predictions for future outcomes | c: To play video games and watch movies | d: To drive cars and fly airplanes
